com.rattat.micro.ui.vibrator
Class Vibrator

java.lang.Object
  com.rattat.micro.ui.vibrator.Vibrator

public final class Vibrator
extends java.lang.Object

Class for performing vibrations. Needs to have a Display object set with setDisplay or it won't do anything. All methods must be called statically

Author:
poobar

Method Summary
static boolean isOn()
          Check if vibrations are turned on or off
static void setDisplay(Display display)
          Set the display object, used to perform the vibration
static void setOn(boolean on)
          Turn vibrations on or off
static void vibrate(int duration)
          Vibrate for a length of time Will quietly fail if there is no display object set
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
